intro: Cyphostemma erythreae, commonly known as the red-eyed cyphostemma, is a climbing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
